title: KC Current shakes things up announcing coaching , GM changes
body_text:
KC Current shakes things up announcing coaching, GM changes
KANSAS CITY, Mo. (KCTV) - The Kansas City Current announced significant staffing changes on Friday, signaling a new phase for the club.
Vlatko Andonovski, who has served as head coach and sporting director for the club since October 2023, will transition into the role of global sporting director.
Ryan Dell has been promoted to general manager, effective immediately, after joining the organization as head of soccer operations in December 2024.
The restructuring aims to expand the technical leadership with separate executives overseeing the roles of sporting director, head coach, and general manager, according to the Current.
The club said the goal will help achieve its vision of becoming the premier women’s soccer club.
The Kansas City Current is currently initiate a search for its next head coach. Andonovski will continue serving as head coach until his successor is appointed.
Co-owners Angie and Chris Long emphasized the importance of these changes.
“To continue the club’s upward and global trajectory, we must put in place an organizational structure that reflects the growth of what we’re doing within the KC Current ecosystem and beyond. These changes will allow us to further carry out our mission of staying at the forefront of women’s soccer globally.”
Vlatko Andonovski: Global Sporting Director
Moving forward Andonovski will collaborate with the incoming head coach and a newly established head of player development to implement the long-term vision for the club’s technical and athletic success. His responsibilities will also include player recruitment, roster strategy, and scouting according to the club.
“Kansas City is, and always will be, home. It’s vital to move into this role to keep growing this club with the aim of being a perennial contender on the global stage and a top developer of talent. From world-class soccer to the first stadium in the world purpose-built for a women’s team to the best fans in the country, I am proud of what has been built here in the city that means so much to me. The potential is limitless for this club, the foundation for further success has been laid and the best is yet to come,” Andonovski said.
In Andonovski’s first year as head coach he orchestrated one of the greatest single-season turnarounds in NWSL history, guiding the team to a 16-3-7 record and 55 points, a significant improvement from the previous season’s 8-12-2 record.
Under his leadership, the Current also set NWSL records for total goals in a single regular season (57) and most goal scorers (18), in addition to winning The Women’s Cup and the inaugural NWSL x Liga MX Femenil Summer Cup. The team finished fourth in the 2024 regular season and reached the NWSL semifinal.
The success continued into 2025, with the Current winning their first-ever NWSL Shield, clinching it with five games remaining. The club established new NWSL regular season records for points (65), wins (21), home wins (11), road wins (10), clean sheets (16), consecutive shutout minutes (869), consecutive shutouts (9), shutouts at home (8), multi-goal wins (15), multi-goal games (18), fewest minutes trailing (109), and fewest goals conceded (13). Kansas City also achieved an undefeated home record for the regular season.
Ryan Dell: General Manager
As general manager, Ryan Dell will assume additional responsibilities including salary cap management, contract negotiation, and player transfers. He will continue to oversee all soccer operations and youth development. Both the global sporting director and general manager roles will report directly to ownership.
“The Kansas City Current embodies the best of women’s sport. That’s the allure of this organization, and that’s why I’m honored to have this opportunity. The youth development pathway we are creating, the incredible support system that’s in place and the best-in-class infrastructure is forever changing the women’s soccer landscape. What’s being built here, and what we will build together in the future, is remarkable, and I’m excited to keep solidifying our place as the leader in the sport,” Dell said.
During his year as the Current’s head of soccer operations, Dell effectively managed all aspects of team logistics and day-to-day operations, including schedule planning, equipment oversight, and administrative support. His entrepreneurial spirit led to the creation of unique club properties, such as the successful Teal Rising Cup. Dell also leads critical efforts surrounding Kansas City Current II and the Teal Rising Alliance, which are fundamental to the player development pathway.
Prior to joining the Kansas City Current, Dell was the inaugural general manager for Racing Louisville FC, where he oversaw performance, player recruitment, and compliance, and served as the liaison between the team and front office. He was instrumental in hiring head coach Bev Yanez and securing a United States Women’s National Team (USWNT) match for Lynn Family Stadium, the team’s first game in the city in 20 years.
Dell’s appointment as general manager coincides with the club’s decision to part ways with Caitlin Carducci, who previously held the general manager position since November 2024.
“We thank Caitlin for her contributions to the Current, and we wish her the best,” said Angie and Chris Long. “This is an important time for our club, and we look forward to building upon the incredible foundation that has been set.”
